    API¶

    greybody_utils¶

    kremboxer.greybody_utils.planck_model(T, A, N)

    Computes a polynomial approximation to the planck curve, A*T^N

    kremboxer.greybody_utils.detector_model(T, G, AL, TD, A, N)

    Model for the detector response when viewing an object at temperature T and when the detector’s temperature is TD

    kremboxer.greybody_utils.GB_lambda(lams, T, emissivity=1)

    Compute the greybody radiation emitted by an object at temperature T

    kremboxer.greybody_utils.GB_lambda_window(lam1, lam2, T, ...)

    Integrated radiance of an object at temperature T over specified wavelengths

    kremboxer.greybody_utils.GB_ratio(T, lam1, lam2, lam3, lam4)

    Compute the ratio of the integrated radiances in two wavelength windows

    kremboxer.greybody_utils.GB_ratio_BP(T, F1, F2)

    Compute the ratio of the integrated radiances in two wavelength windows, accounting for bandbass of detector

    kremboxer.greybody_utils.stefan_boltzmann(T, emissivity=1)

    Compute the total radiation emitted by a greybody object via Stefan-Boltzmann law

    kremboxer.greybody_utils.detector_temperature_lookup(R, ...)

    Converts a resistance reading into a temperature measurement

    krembox_utils¶

    kremboxer.krembox_utils.get_signal_bounds(data: array, p_start, ...)

    Compute the indices, ind_start ind_end, containing the specified percentage of the signal’s integrated weight. IE p_start of the signal occurs before ind_start, p_end of the signal occurs before ind_end.

    krembox_dualband_utils¶

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_utils.parse_header(fields, header)
    Parameters¶
    fields

    header

    Returns¶

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_utils.associate_data2burnplot(...)
    Parameters¶
    rad_data_gdf

    burn_plot_gdf

    Returns¶

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_utils.plot_processed_dualband_data(...)
    Parameters¶
    rad_df

    plot_outfile

    show_plot

    dt_start

    dt_end

    sup_title

    Returns¶

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_utils.plot_osceola_statistics(gdf, ...)

    Makes a plot with statistics computed from all the Osceola FRP datasets at Osceola, ex: fire duration, max FRP, vs treatment Note that this only works for the Osceola datasets, because of the special association between treatments and burn units :param rad_data_gdf: :param plot_output_dir: :return:

    krembox_dualband_calibrate¶

    krembox_dualband_cleaner¶

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_cleaner.process_data_series(...)
    Parameters¶
    data_series

    target_dates

    file

    data_directory

    clean_file_list

    Returns¶

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_cleaner.run_krembox_dualband_cleaner(...)

    Cleans the raw datafiles from raw krembox data stored in specified directories. Only keeps data from the specified target dates

    krembox_dualband_frp¶

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_frp.load_calibration_data(cal_params)

    Loads the calibration data needed to process the raw KremBox data, including bandpasses, detector model parameters, and temperature sensor look up table

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_frp.compute_FRP(rad_data: DataFrame, ...)

    Use the dualband data to compute the target temperature, emissivity Area product, and FRP of the fire passing under the krembox :param rad_data: :param F_MW: :param F_LW: :param model_params: :param detect_temp_cal_data: :return:

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_frp.run_krembox_dualband_frp(params)
    Parameters¶
    params

    Returns¶

    krembox_dualband_vis¶

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_vis.animate_burn_unit(rad_data_gdf, ...)

    Animate the time traces of the FRP measurements from each radiometer in the burn unit :param rad_data_gdf: :param burn_plot_gdf: :param burn_unit: :param plot_output_dir: :param plot_title_prefix: :return:

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_vis.plot_burn_unit(rad_data_gdf, ...)

    Plots data associated with a given burn unit :param rad_data_gdf: :param burn_plot_gdf: :param burn_unit: :param plot_output_dir: :return:

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_vis.plot_burn_unit_map(...)

    Makes a simple plot of all the burn units :param burn_plot_gdf: :param plot_output_dir: :param plot_title_prefix: :return:

    kremboxer.krembox_dualband_vis.run_krembox_dualband_vis(vis_params)

    Runs visualizer :param vis_params: :return:

    kremboxer¶

    kremboxer.kremboxer.main(argv)

    Main user entry point for the Kremboxer code. All parts of the dualband calibration and FRP computation can be launched by providing this script with a JSON parameter file as a command line argument
